definition: to appoint/(job) appointment/CL:紙|纸[zhi3]
surname Ren/Ren County 任縣|任县[Ren2 Xian4] in Hebei

to assign/to appoint/to take up a post/office/responsibility/to let/to allow/to give free rein to/no matter (how, what etc)/classifier for terms served in office, or for spouses, girlfriends etc (as in 前任男友)
life/fate/order or command/to assign a name, title etc
certificate of appointment (to government office)

sentences.english: Enter the recently named Vice President, Lieut.
sentences.chinese: 输入最近任命为副总裁，上尉。

sentences.english: Some time afterwards, M. Madeleine was appointed mayor.
sentences.chinese: 过些日子，马德兰先生被任命为市长。

sentences.english: Arnesen has been given the role of head talent scout, in charge of uncovering football talents.
sentences.chinese: 阿内森被任命为球探总管，负责发掘足球天才。

sentences.english: He appointed his son, Senwesret I, as co-ruler.
sentences.chinese: 他还任命儿子赛恩沃斯里特一世为共同统治者。

sentences.english: Currently only Jordan's king has that right.
sentences.chinese: 目前仅约旦国王有任命首相的权力。

sentences.english: The Church instituted the young man into a benefice.
sentences.chinese: 教会任命这个年轻人担任牧师一职。

sentences.english: She was assisted in the management of her vast property by her son-in-law Mathur Mohan.
sentences.chinese: 她被女婿马图尔巴乌任命去协助管理巨大的财富。

sentences.english: The President designated him for premiership.
Accordingly Fakeer appointed Colman very quickly.
sentences.chinese: 因此法科尔很快任命了科尔曼。

sentences.english: At the time, his appointment seemed a stroke of genius.
sentences.chinese: 当时，对他的任命犹如神来之笔。

sentences.english: Wang Baoming was appointed Director of the Labor and Social Security Office of Zhengzhou.
sentences.chinese: 任命王保明为郑州市劳动和社会保障局局长。

sentences.english: All the big banks are state-owned and their chairmen are appointed by the government.
sentences.chinese: 所有大银行都是国有的，董事长都是由政府任命。

sentences.english: The Indian cricket board, the BCCI, named an interim IPL chairman after crisis talks on Monday.
sentences.chinese: 印度板球协会BCCI已经任命了一名临时主席。

sentences.english: I think he will be reconfirmed.
sentences.chinese: 我认为他的任命会得到确认。

sentences.english: Soon after he was asked to work with an Intercollegiate Commission to form a system of academic apparel.
sentences.chinese: 不久，他被任命到校际委员会来规划一套学位服。

sentences.english: He was nominated as vice - director of the institute.
sentences.chinese: 他被任命为研究所副所长。

definition: to appoint
to be promoted to
post/position/job/duties
to transfer/to move to another post
to take up a post/to start in a new job
to take over (as minister, manager etc)
newly-appointed/newly elected/new (in a political office)
to promote (sb)/to upgrade/to ascend
to hold several jobs at once/concurrent post/working part-time
to appoint
to succeed sb in a job/successor
to hold an office or post
to take office/to assume a post
key job/important position
to set apart/to assign sb to a job
to hold a governmental office or post/to assume office of/to take charge of/to serve as
